metadata.title: Extensive Homeostatic T Cell Phenotypic Variation within the Collaborative Cross Cell Reports Resource Extensive Homeostatic T Cell Phenotypic Variation within the Collaborative Cross

abstract.original_text: Graphical Abstract Highlights d The Collaborative Cross models the phenotypic diversity observed in human immunity d QTL mapping in the CC reveals candidate genes linked to T cell phenotypes In Brief Graham et al. advance the use of the Collaborative Cross (CC), a panel of reproducible recombinant inbred mouse strains, for immunology research. They demonstrate that the CC better models the phenotypic diversity in human T cell immunity and use quantitative trait locus mapping to reveal candidate genes linked to T cell phenotypes.

a panel of reproducible recombinant inbred mouse strains , for immunology research .
They demonstrate that the CC better models the phenotypic diversity in human T cell immunity and use quantitative trait locus mapping to reveal candidate genes linked to T cell phenotypes .
